results.title: Preparing your child for school. Parts 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Glenn McIver, Trevor Lunn and Healthsharing Women. Publishing and Production Group
results.brief_description: Part 1. Discussion is centered on helping children handle being separated from their parents, relating to other children and adults, gaining independence and responsibility in new situations and encouraging curiosity and confidence. Part 2. Encompasses a number of practical considerations which parents will find helpful in preparing their child for school, such as clothing, lunches and school bags.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jeff Spencer, Glenn McIver, Trevor Lunn and Healthsharing Women. Publishing and Production Group

results.title: Duke Nukem for Game Boy Color
results.brief_description: Duke Nukem’s world-saving exploits have attracted the attention of a new alien foe, the Zorgonites. They plan kidnap the smartest minds in the universe - including Duke’s - to power their hyper-intelligent war machine and conquer the universe. The game takes the player around the world and beyond to stop this from happening. A Game Boy Colour port of Duke Nukem II, much as been changed. For instance, the Zorgonites were originally called the Rigelatins. The levels, weapons, items, enemies, and bosses are almost completely different.

results.title: Regular homotopies in the plane. No. 2 (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: William Hansard and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Geometry”.
Uses computer-generated animation in order to illustrate the Whitney-Graustein theorem - two regular curves in the plane are regularly homotopic if, and only if, they have the same rotation number.

results.title: Prostate disease
results.creator_credit: Diane Sundin, Peter Campbell, Merck, Sharp and Dohme and Special Broadcasting Services
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “English at work”.
This program looks at the early symptoms of prostate problems, how many men react to these and what men need to do to prevent prostate cancer. An excellent progam to encourage men to have check ups at an early stage of problems. Partly dramatised.

results.title: Regular homotopies in the plane. No. 1 (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: William Hansard and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Geometry”.
Computer animation records the deformation of regular closed curves and the rotation of tangent vectors and demonstrates the theorem that two regular curves in the plane which are regularly homotopic must have the same rotation number. Concludes with a concrete problem and a challenge to explore the converse of the theorem as discussed in part 2.
results.description:

results.title: English at work
results.brief_description: Designed to introduce migrants to aspects of Australian society and provide them with information and language required in specific contexts such as filing a tax return or buying a car.

results.title: Turning a sphere inside out (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: William Hansard, David Nelson and Educational Development Center
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Geometry”
Uses advanced computer animation to discuss the problem of turning a sphere inside out by passing the surface through itself without making any holes or creases. Illustrates the homotopy with a sequence of models, showing the crucial stages in the motion.

results.title: Space filling curves (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: William Hansard, Education Development Center and Topology Films Project
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Geometry”.
Using computer animation the concept of a limit curve is graphically portrayed as a sequence of approximate curves and applied to the construction of space filling curves; curves which pass through every point in a square.

results.title: Family Court
results.creator_credit: Peter Campbell, Diane Sundin, Family Court of Australia and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 58 of Series “English at work”.
This video explains the role of the Family Court in divorce cases. It explains the grounds for applying for divorce, and the issues involved in a divorce in Australia. It also explains options offered by the Family Court after an application for divorce has been made: the structure of Information sessions, conciliation conferences, and court counsellors to help resolve differences in the main areas of dispute; children and property.

results.title: Prejudice: equality ...at what price
results.creator_credit: Ian Munro, Pamela Williams and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A provocative docu-drama portraying two cases of female discrimination experienced by separate women from unrelated backgrounds. Jessica, a newspaper photographer is subjected to a campaign of sexual harassment and Letitia is denied a promotion and subjected to humiliating racist comments from her colleagues. The stories are linked by the Anti-Discrimination Board, established to investigate and conciliate complaints of prejudice and discrimination. Combines the use of actors and “actual” professional people including Officers of the ADB, union representatives and members of the legal profession play themselves.
